description: Side roof extension to South East side of the roof (involving conversion of roofspace to habitable use), demolition of the chimney breasts to the North West and South East sides of the property, and installation of one rooflight to North East and one to North West roofslope
decision_conditions: The proposed roof extension, due to its position on the side roofslope, is considered to  be significantly detrimental to the character and appearance of the property, unbalancing  the design of the dwelling and the lawful pattern of development within the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Conservation Area as a whole. As such, the proposal is not considered to be compliant with The London Plan (consolidated - 2015) polices 7.4 (local character) & 7.6 (architecture), Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7A (amenity) & 7B (design amenity) and the Hanger Hill (Haymills) Conservation Area Management Plan, Section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and section 12 The National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
